metadata.purpose: Reference validation and local archival for soliton_validation.tex

Alcubierre1994.title: The warp drive: hyper-fast travel within general relativity
Alcubierre1994.expected_citation: Alcubierre, Miguel. The warp drive: hyper-fast travel within general relativity. Classical and Quantum Gravity, 11(5):L73-L77, 1994.

Lentz2021.title: Breaking the warp barrier: hyper-fast solitons in Einstein-Maxwell-plasma theory
Lentz2021.expected_citation: Lentz, Erik W. Breaking the warp barrier: hyper-fast solitons in Einstein-Maxwell-plasma theory. Classical and Quantum Gravity, 38(7):075015, 2021.
Lentz2021.notes: AUDIT ~106: Cited for positive energy densities. Line 106: 'Lentz hyperfast solitons operating with positive energy densities'. Line 108: 'energy densities of ~10^12 J rather than 10^64 J'. Integration appropriate for foundational theory.

carleo2019machine.title: Machine learning and the physical sciences
carleo2019machine.expected_citation: Carleo, G., Cirac, I., Cranmer, K., et al. Machine learning and the physical sciences. Reviews of Modern Physics, 91(4):045002, 2019.
carleo2019machine.notes: AUDIT ~228: Cited for machine learning optimization algorithms. Line 228: 'advanced multi-objective optimization algorithms for soliton envelope shaping, power budget management, and temporal energy distribution'. Supports ML-based optimization approaches in the computational framework.

alcubierre2000superluminal.title: The Alcubierre Warp Drive: On the Matter of Matter
alcubierre2000superluminal.expected_citation: McMonigal, B., Lewis, G.F., O'Byrne, P. The Alcubierre Warp Drive: On the Matter of Matter. Physical Review D, 85:064024, 2012.
alcubierre2000superluminal.notes: AUDIT ~228: Cited for optimization algorithms and energy requirements. Line 228: 'advanced multi-objective optimization algorithms for soliton envelope shaping, power budget management, and temporal energy distribution'. Canonical energy requirement studies properly referenced with DOI.

larbalestier2014hts.title: High-temperature superconducting materials for electric power applications
larbalestier2014hts.expected_citation: Larbalestier, D.C., Gurevich, A., Feldmann, D.M., and Polyanskii, A. High-temperature superconducting materials for electric power applications. Nature, 414:368-377, 2001.

freidberg2014plasma.expected_citation: Freidberg, J.P. Ideal MHD. Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 2014.

Einstein1916.title: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
Einstein1916.expected_citation: Einstein, Albert. Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie. Annalen der Physik, 49(7):769-822, 1916.
Einstein1916.notes: AUDIT ~112: Cited for Einstein's field equations foundation. Line 112: 'Lentz hyperfast solitons emerge from solutions to Einstein's field equations'. Foundational reference for general relativity framework underlying soliton theory.

Maxwell1865.title: A dynamical theory of the electromagnetic field
Maxwell1865.expected_citation: Maxwell, James Clerk. A dynamical theory of the electromagnetic field. Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society, 155:459-512, 1865.
